 @boody is made from bamboo viscose and I’m obsessed with how comfortable and breathable their products are!

I’m trying on their wireless bra and briefs and they’re literally the perfect everyday set,so cozy!
I love a brief that sits high on my waist and a wireless bra that doesn’t dig in my skin! This fabric is perfection as far as I’m concerned.

This season I’m in craves ease and comfort and I’m blown away by not only how stylish these pieces are but truly by the way they make me look and feel! Boody is non toxic, and PETA-Vegan certified! You know I love my sustainability!

To celebrate launching Vegan Silk, we collaborated with @dreamlabsau by @tokyoheadspa to treat the Boody team to a massage experience that encourages quality sleep and restfulness 💤

Dream Labs is a transcendent massage experience that uses tranquil visuals, gentle lights, calming sounds and soothing scents- harmonised with the expert touch of a Japanese head, neck, shoulder and chest massage.

This experience paired with our Vegan Silk sleepwear was a match made in heaven ☁️

Four years ago today, I had a double mastectomy after being diagnosed with an aggressive form of breast cancer. In celebration of being a cancer warrior, I wear my @boody pink limited edition t-shirt bra today, with 100% of the profits going to breast cancer care nurses (angels & lifesavers) in October. You’ve got a few days to buy one in support.

PS is possibly the best bra I’ve ever worn, especially for a mastectomy/reconstruction patient.
PPS HAVE YOUR BREASTS CHECKED

#breastcancerawarenessmonth #breastcancerawareness #breastcancerwarrior #boody #bcampink #notanad #Mammogram #breastchecks

If you grow them, you should know them 🩷

October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, focused on increasing awareness of breast cancer, encouraging early detection, and providing support for those affected by breast cancer.

This is your reminder to CHECK YOUR CHEST 🍈🍈

& if you are having trouble remembering why not invest in a pair of bright pink pants or this bralette so whenever you see them in your underwear draw it’s a little visual reminder that it might be time for a check 👍🏼

ALL PROFITS from the sale of this wonderful collaboration between @coppafeel & @boody (Australian BCORP brand) go directly to @coppafeel.  I’ll pop a link in stories to the site and also to the incredible @howtoglitteraturd ‘Living Every Second’ documentary which aired last night in the UK on BBC2 but can now be found on iPlayer.  I met Kris back in 2010 when I was working on a shoot and will always remember how brightly she shone and her incredible outlook on life 🤍🙏🏼 

Sending love to anyone that has been affected by cancer 🙏🏼

We’re proud to support FSC® Forest Week 🌳

As a promotional licence holder, we’re committed to ensuring our bamboo is responsibly sourced from sustainably managed forests. This supports the protection of wildlife and the rights of communities and workers dependent on forests, while also contributing to the fight against climate change and the loss of biodiversity.

This year’s theme is ‘small steps together create big change for all’. Ready to make a positive impact?
Start with something as simple as changing your underwear 🩲

When you see the FSC® logo, you can trust that your products are sourced responsibly. Let’s make a difference together!

FSC® N004457

#FSCForestWeek @fsc_anz

Reasons why you should switch to comfy underwear during pregnancy 👇

🤰 Changing Body Shape: Comfy underwear can adapt to these changes, providing better support and fit.

☁️ Increased Sensitivity: Pregnant women often experience increased sensitivity in their skin, especially around the belly and breasts. Soft, breathable fabrics like bamboo viscose helps reduce irritation and discomfort.

🩸 Improved Circulation: Tight or restrictive underwear can impede circulation, which is already a concern during pregnancy due to increased blood volume.

📷 @tammflow

Trigger Warning: This video discusses domestic violence, which may be distressing or triggering for some individuals. Viewer discretion is advised.

In Australia, 1 in 4 women have experienced physical and/or sexual violence from an intimate partner since the age of 15*.

Boody and clothing charity @thread_together have launched a project to assist women and children fleeing domestic violence, installing 100 capsule wardrobes of brand new clothing into women’s shelters across Australia. Providing them access to new clothing is about more than the fabric; it’s about helping them reclaim who they are. @afterpayau has been supporting Thread Together initiatives since 2020.

If you or someone you know is experiencing, or at risk of experiencing, domestic, family or sexual violence, call 1800RESPECT on 1800 737 732, text 0458 737 732 or visit http://1800respect.org.au for online chat and video call services.

Aboriginal or Torres Straight Islander viewers may also reach out to 13YARN (13 92 76) - a culturally safe and free 24/7 crisis line for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples who are having difficulty coping. Highly trained Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are there to take your call when you are feeling overwhelmed or feeling no good.

*Source: https://www.aihw.gov.au/family-domestic-and-sexual-violence/types-of-violence/intimate-partner-violence

Last week, with our partners at @thread_together , we marked the installation of the 100th capsule wardrobe in domestic violence shelters across Sydney, with plans now underway to roll out the next 100 💚

Women and girls often flee dangerous situations with nothing more than the clothes on their back, giving them access to choose clean, new clothing is an essential step in restoring their sense of self and the confidence they need to move forwards, at a time when choice has been taken away from them for so long.

#InternationalWomensDay #ThreadTogether #Boody

Essentials made equal.

No, we didn’t make a % copy mistake when planning this sale. We’ve decided to take 21.7% off because that’s the current % pay gap in Australia* for women.

So this International Women’s Day, we’re doing things differently to raise awareness. We hope that as a brand that stands for making you comfy, we can push for progress together.

Use Code: IWD

Code is applicable until Monday 11th March 11:59 pm, on full-price womenswear styles, excludes sale items.
*We’re an Australian-founded company and wanted to apply the same discount to our friends around the world, this International Women’s Day

Together, with the WNBL charity partner, @sharethedignityaustralia, we are raising awareness and products for those in need.

Happy International Comfy Pants Day! 

Here at Boody, we’re big fans of being comfy ☁️

So, imagine our joy when we discovered that there’s a day devoted to our favourite loungewear essentials.
 
January 21st is officially known as International Comfy Pants Day. 

To celebrate the day, we encourage you to slip into something a little softer and a whole lot comfier ☺️

There’s never been a better time, or a better reason to grab yourself a pair of period undies. 🤍 20% of people who menstruate in Australia currently lack access to essential sanitary products and period care. 1/5 - a statistic that must change. @boody has partnered with @thewnbl and @sharethedignityaustralia to help fight period poverty. For every pair of period underwear purchased this month, Boody will donate a pair to someone in need. 

#ad

Boody will provide 1,000 pairs of period undies for the round and we have 8x Double Passes to give away to our community 💚

Mood 💤

This was Fidel the dog from Bruges, Belgium 🐶

The Yellow Labrador Retriever lived at the Côté Canal bed and breakfast with his owner, Caroline Van Langeraet. 

He was usually seen lounging half-asleep on a windowsill facing the Groenerei canal. His owner said that it was his favourite spot for years, in all seasons.

He sadly passed away in 2016, but remains a beautiful memory for many tourists and visitors.

With your help from the Undie Exchange, we have saved hundreds of pairs of undies from landfill ♻️

These are now with our clothing recycling partner @upparelofficial ready for a new purpose ✨

Your undies will be shredded and processed into a fine, fluffy fibre that can be used to replace polyester fill, wall insulation and acoustic panelling 🏠

⚠️ Please note, our partnership with UPPAREL has allowed us to recycle underwear through them, however, at this current time, UPPAREL does not accept old underwear from the public due to hygiene regulations

We are working together to make underwear recycling a reality, so watch this space! 🙌

This time of the year can be overwhelming 😵‍💫

Here are a few questions to ask yourself before you buy something ⬇️

☁️ Is this a need or a want?

☁️ Am I only buying it because it’s on sale?

☁️ Is it trendy or timeless?
 
☁️ Have I researched this product enough?

☁️ Does the brand align with my own values?

☁️ Do I already own something similar?

☁️ Will I feel confident and comfortable in this?

☁️ Are the care instructions easy to follow?

A NEW bra just arrived! 👀 👏🏼 
Introducing the ✨Front Closure Bra✨

In support of Breast Cancer Awareness Month, we’ve worked alongside nurses and patients to create our most special product yet. 💕

This front-fastening bra, expertly crafted from viscose derived from organically grown bamboo, is designed to provide utmost comfort and ease of use.

Whether you’re recovering from breast surgery or simply looking for a bra that’s easy to put on and incredibly comfortable, our Front Closure Bra is designed for you.

✔️ Easy on, easy off with front closure clasps
✨ V-shape, wide straps, and adjustable sliders
🚫 Wire free and gentle on sensitive skin
🥰 Removable inserts for your comfort

To mark the last week of Boody Cares September - a month long team culture initiative, we got very creative and participated in a life drawing class! 🖼️ 

Benefits of life drawing ✍️ 
✨ Promotes observation skills
✨ Encourages being in the moment 
✨ A fun way to unwind 

Here’s a snippet of our night 👏🏼

“Whilst it may seem counterintuitive to highlight the discomfort so many women face each day, these uncomfortable truths required a bold statement to drive meaningful reappraisal of something we have learned to live with for decades, as ‘the best we’ll get’. Alongside our continued, passionate commitment to ethical and sustainable production, it really is time to demand more from your underwear drawer.” - Ruth Haffenden, Boody’s Global Head of Brand and Marketing

We're so PROUD 🥹 of our new campaign and are so delighted to see you all love it too. 

Now go on, Make Yourself Comfortable ✨
P-R-O-U-D 🥹 Join the Boody marketing team on our billboard tour through Sydney to spot our campaign! 👀 🚶‍♀️ 🪧

Introducing.
Make Yourself Comfortable. ✨

The campaign is driven by the confronting revelation that women spend a cumulative 27 years of their lives enduring discomfort from underwear that digs and rubs, alongside bras that leave deep impressions in the skin. This reality is widely accepted despite 30% of women saying uncomfortable underwear impacts their mood. 😦

We’re challenging the norm and inviting you to demand more from your underwear drawer. We firmly believe that the best impression your underwear can make is no impression at all. 🚫 

In our bold and empowering campaign, we’ve showcased the unmistakable marks left by uncomfortable underwear. We’re calling out to the 50% of women who can’t wait to free themselves from their bras the moment they get home. Join us on this liberating journey to ‘Make Yourself Comfortable’ with our incredibly soft, organically grown bamboo viscose underwear. 💚👏✨🙌

"Boody’s LYOLYTE® Racerback Bra is a dream. It’s designed to provide the coverage you need while still being incredibly comfortable, and it’s made from moisture-wicking fabric that keeps you cool and dry all day long.

This bra has a 3cm ribbed band for extra support, as well as double front layers for extra coverage. Its soft, thin elastic straps keep things comfortable without slipping off your shoulders, and the cross-back design makes it easy to put on and take off without having to adjust straps or do any contorting in front of the mirror.

The bra itself is made from a fine light knit that’s breathable, so you can wear it all day long without feeling hot or uncomfortable."

Boody Guide | 4 Steps to Better Sleep 💤

1️⃣ Don’t have caffeine too late in the day ☕️
Coffee can stimulate your nervous system and may prevent your body from being able to naturally relax at night. 

2️⃣ Consider your sleeping environment 🛏️
From blocking out natural light to reducing outside noise, there are so many ways we can adjust our sleeping environments to cure our sleep problems. 

3️⃣ Wear comfy sleepwear ☁️
Comfy, breathable and thermoregulating loungewear and sleepwear is ideal for allowing your skin to breathe as you unwind and get into bed. 

4️⃣ Read a book 📖
Always a great habit to factor into your before-sleep schedule. Even if you can squeeze in 20 minutes of reading you’re likely to notice yourself feeling naturally sleepy.

Here's a Plastic Free July Tip from us 🌎🌱

"Stay and enjoy" this weekend instead of taking it to-go. 

Whether it be on your morning coffee run or when grabbing a mid-afternoon bite to eat, opt for sitting down at a cafe instead of getting takeaway.

Not only will you reduce plastic waste by removing the need for a to-go container, but this will allow you to mindfully enjoy your meal and take in your surroundings ✨

We are thrilled to announce that Boody has not one, not two, but THREE incredible nominations in the prestigious Bounty Baby Awards, 2023! 🏆👶 @bountyparents 

Our products have been recognised in the following categories:

1️⃣ Best Maternity Bra: Bamboo Shaper Crop Bra 
2️⃣ Best Product for Mum: Bamboo Classic Bikini 
3️⃣ Best New Product (2022+): Bamboo Period & Leak-proof Underwear

We are incredibly proud to have our products acknowledged in these categories, and it wouldn't have been possible without the support and love from our amazing community. 🙌✨

Now, we need YOUR help! We invite all of you to vote for Boody and show your appreciation for these incredible nominations. By casting your vote, you'll automatically be entered into a draw to WIN an amazing Bounty Baby prize pack valued at over $2,500AUD! 🎁🎉

Here's how you can vote and enter to win:

1️⃣ Visit the Bounty Baby Awards website. Find the voting link via our Instagram Stories.
2️⃣ Look for the categories mentioned above and locate the Boody products within each.
3️⃣ Click on the vote button and follow the simple instructions to cast your vote.

Hurry! Voting closes on the 17th of July, so make sure to vote and spread the word among your friends and family. Let's unite and showcase why Boody deserves to win!

We extend our heartfelt gratitude for being a part of our incredible community and for your unwavering support. Together, let's celebrate these nominations and continue to make a positive impact. 🌱💚

Here's why you should sleep in bamboo ✨

☁️ Bamboo fibre gets softer and softer as it's washed - bamboo fibres line up, rather than move out of position.

☁️ Bamboo fibre smoothly falls into place in its weave, leaving gaps open for air to flow freely. This provides ventilation and evaporates moisture that causes bacteria to multiply.

☁️ Bamboo fibre is naturally absorbent and speedily wicks away moisture - up to 4x faster than cotton.

We’re passionate about making you feel comfy. It’s been our brand mantra from day one. So, this new partnership with @australianbirthstories ’, Sophie Walker has us so excited.

After her continued success with podcast Australian Birth Stories, we’ve worked with Sophie on a new conversation - in fact, one that doesn’t get spoken about much at all - the Fourth Trimester.

In this new 5-part postpartum podcast series, five leading perinatal specialists each share their expertise in a welcoming and conversational way.

We’re supporting the conversation with all the comfy essentials one needs - for this time and beyond. Working on an exclusive edit together, we’ve pulled together our softest essential pieces that ensure that while you’re going through this new phase in your life - you feel comfy and supported by us.

Listen to the podcast and shop the edit now - link in bio. 

💓 We understand that the fourth trimester can be a hugely challenging time, both mentally and physically, for the whole family. If you or someone you know is struggling during this postpartum period please reach out to your healthcare professional or call PANDA on 1300 726 306 💓

@kana_melia in our Dark Olive underwear set 🫒

#boody #underwear #wirelessbra #bamboobras #ecofriendly #bamboounderwear

Did you know? The term Fourth Trimester is actually a new one. First coined by US paediatrician Harvey Karp in 2002, the fourth trimester is the 12 weeks after birth. 👶

Karp highlights the fact that even though your baby is outside your body, they’re still very much connected to you. Indeed, newborn babies are still growing and functioning as if they’re in utero; wholly dependent on you as they very slowly and tentatively adjust to life outside the womb.

The fourth trimester is an intense period that can be incredibly challenging, especially if you don’t know what’s normal or expected. Even the normal and expected parts are hard; you are recovering and healing from birth, processing your birth, learning to read your baby’s cues, and establishing a breastfeeding rhythm or feeding routine and you’re doing this while navigating sleep deprivation. It’s a time of significant upheaval where everything is unknown and you’re experiencing almighty hormonal shifts, too.

Discover our Fourth Trimester Edit - link in bio.

The Fourth Trimester (definition)

The 12-week period immediately after you have had your baby. A time of great physical and emotional change as your baby adjusts to being outside the womb, and you adjust to your new life as a mum. ☁️

💓 We understand that the fourth trimester can be a hugely challenging time, both mentally and physically, for the whole family. If you or someone you know is struggling during this postpartum period please reach out to your healthcare professional or call PANDA on 1300 726 306 💓

Did you know? | Fertilise your plants with these 3 common kitchen scraps 🌱

🍌 Banana peels - Can be placed directly onto pot plant soil, or around the base of your garden as mulch. As they decompose, they will release nutrients into the soil to feed plants.

☕️ Ground coffee - After using, sprinkle them thinly onto your soil, or add them to your compost heap. Coffee grounds also help attract worms!

🥚 Egg shells - Add crushed eggshells around the base of your plant. The calcium from eggshells helps moderates soil acidity and provides nutrients for plants.

#boody #ecotips #planttips #gardening #didyouknow

As we settle into a new year and get back into routines, here's some tips on avoiding food waste while meal prepping 🥦🥕💚

1️⃣ Use what you have already
2️⃣ Plan meals that build on one another
3️⃣ Make a list and stick to it
4️⃣ Share leftovers with friends and family
5️⃣ Freeze ingredients for later use

☁️ We’re taking a break ☁️

As a brand that is always telling you to be kind to yourself, it seems kind of hypocritical of us to not practice what we preach.

So, we’ve decided to take two weeks off our organic social media channels. It’s been a big year and we too, need some time to reset and recharge for the year ahead.

We recommend you also take the time to switch off and just be in the moment. Whether that be with family and friends, cooking something delicious, or being outside in nature.

Please know that you can still reach out to us. Some of our community management team members will be taking their holiday season break throughout other times during the year. Any questions can be DM’d or emailed to support@boody.com.au

Thank you for all the love over the last year. 
You mean the world to us. 🌏

See you next year!
Team Boody 💚

Earlier this week, we stood with the amazing team at @thread_together to help launch a project to assist women and children fleeing domestic violence situations with the installation of 100 wardrobes into women’s refuges across the nation over the next 12 months. 

The Thread Together Wardrobe and capsule service will allow women and their children to access clean new clothing which will include Boody underwear, socks, sleepwear and tracksuits, amongst much more, when they arrive at a shelter.

The wardrobes will also allow them to choose those basics for themselves, at a time where choice has often been taken away from them and at a time where even the smallest home comforts can make the world of difference.

This incredible initiative was only made possible by the collaboration between the  @payce_foundation , @commbank and their next chapter initiative, @goodman.group , @princesspollyboutique , @ikea_australia and the tireless efforts of those at @thread_together 💚

This time of the year can be a bit hectic. Here's a little reminder to take some time out of your day to reset and recharge. 💚

We are proud to be apart of #partofthethread with @thread_together 🪡🧶

Partnering to create tangible change for communities across Australia, we are working closely with our friends at @thread_together to collectively clothe many people in need during this holiday season.

Thread together is Australia's largest fashion charity providing individuals across Australia experiencing hardship with access to brand-new, high quality clothing sourced from some of the biggest names in the Australian Fashion Industry.

Joined by our passion for change and desire to give people their best during their darkest hours, together with your help, we can restore dignity and hope. 

$5 donations from customers and corporations means a brand new wardrobe of 20-30 items will go to an individual experiencing hardship.

With all these sales happening, it can be a little overwhelming. Here are a few questions to ask yourself this weekend. 

☁️ Is this a need or a want?
☁️ Would I buy this if it was full price?
☁️ Can I see myself wearing / using this in a years time?
☁️ Does this brand align to my own values?
☁️ Does the brand actively give back? If so, how?
☁️ Does this brand care about quality, longevity and how things are made?

Did you know? | The 4 phases of your cycle 

🩸 Day 1-7: Menstrual phase 
The hormone progesterone plunges, causing the uterine lining to shed. This is your period!

〰️ Day 7-14: Follicular phase
Your pituitary gland releases a hormone called Follicle Stimulating Hormone (FSH). This hormone stimulates your ovaries to produce around 5 to 20 small sacs called follicles. Each follicle contains an immature egg.

🥚 Day 14-21: Ovulation phase
An egg gets released from its follicle in your ovary and will survive for 12-24 hours.

〰️ Day 21-28: Luteal phase
After the follicle releases its egg, it changes into the corpus luteum. If you do get pregnant, your body will produce human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG). 

This is the hormone pregnancy tests detect. It helps keep the uterine lining thick and maintains the corpus luteum.

If you don’t get pregnant, the corpus luteum will shrink away and be resorbed. This leads to decreased levels of estrogen and progesterone, which causes the onset of your period.

How easy? It’s that easy. 👌

Washing period and leak-proof underwear is simple!
1. Rinse in cold water until it runs clear 
2. Wash on a cold cycle or hand wash (use a wash bag to help your undies last longer)
3. Line dry only! (Place in sunlight for anti-microbial properties)

Why should you wear sleepwear?
​ 
❄️ Protects your body from the cold
​
​Although some suggest sleeping in the nude, wearing bamboo pyjamas has benefits to keeping your body warm throughout the night, allowing you to have restful sleep.
​
​🫧 Great for staying hygienic
​
​When we sleep, our skin sheds dead skin cells and renews itself. Your sleepwear acts as a barrier between your body and bed sheets- both need to be washed on a regular basis. 
​
​✨ Comfortable and stylish
​
​Don’t compromise on style when picking out sleepwear. We launched timeless pieces that you can wear all day long.

DAY 29 | DIY oat milk

Your challenge:
Let's make oat milk from scratch!
Did you know cartons used for things like milk, juice, stock, etc. are made with a combination of cardboard, plastic and foil, which actually very difficult to recycle.

What you need:
- 1 cup rolled oats 
- 4 cups water
- 1 pinch salt
- 1/2 tsp of vanilla extract (optional)
- Tea towel or clean t-shirt

How:
1. Add oats, water, salt and vanilla extract to a blender.
2. Blend for 30 seconds - 1 minute or until the mixture looks well combined. But try not to over blend. 
3. Pour and strain the mixture over a large mixing bowl covered with a tea towel or clean t-shirt. Repeat twice.
4. Transfer into a sealed container and refrigerate.

Consume within 5 days. Keep refrigerated. 
Shake well and enjoy cold.
Our recipe works for a NutriBullet, feel free to double or triple the recipe for a larger quantity.
With this recipe, do not heat or it will thicken and become gelatinous.

If you know of any other alternative milk recipes, leave them down below for everyone to try!

DAY 28 | Plastic free party decorations 
​
​Your challenge: 
Refuse balloons and other single-use plastic party decorations!

Although parties are fun, decorations are often made from single-use plastics. 
That's no fun for the environment.

How: 
💚 Digital invitations instead of traditional paper invites
💚 Swapping glitter for confetti made out of dried flowers
💚 Replacing single-use plastic cups with thrifted mugs / cups with name labels
💚 Use reusable straws made from metal, glass or bamboo! 

Suggest below any other eco decoration ideas you have in mind!

DAY 27 | Sanitary items
​
Your challenge:
Tampons and pads are made with plastic or are packaged in plastic.
​
The packaging used for tampons and sanitary pads contains single-use plastics. A huge number of these are flushed down the toilet, ending up in our rivers and oceans. 
​These can cause ingestion issues for animals.
​
Make the swap and look to using reusable menstrual cups, period underwear and washable cotton pads/liners.
​
If you're a big Boody fan, we have some exciting things happening later this year... watch this space! 👀 Can you guess?

DAY 26 | And that's the tea

Your challenge:
Let's rethink our teabag usage.
Did you know that most tea bags are made from plastic fibres or sealed with plastic coating or adhesive? You'll be surprised to know that most teabags contain up to 25% of plastic! Crazy!

How:
- Check your teabag stock and aim to replace these teabags with loose leaf tea or biodegradable tea bags once you're done with your current ones.

Make some loose leaf tea - in a metal infuser, strainer or teapot!

Share some tea with a colleague, family or friend and let them know the facts about teabags!

DAY 25 | Eco-friendly pet care
​
​Your challenge:
Let's try some plastic-free pet care tips in July!
We want to ensure our furry family member contributes as small of an eco-footprint as possible! 

How: 
💚 Avoid single-use plastic bags and pick up pet poo with a shovel or pooper scooper. If you're out on a walk, you can use compostable bags or scrap pieces of paper, newspaper or paper bags. 

💚 Pet food often comes in plastic bags, avoid this by making your pet's food yourself! 

💚 You can compost pet poo (make sure it's separate from compost for a vegetable garden) 

💚 Pet fur can also be added to compost or used to feed a worm farm!

Challenge yourself and another pet owner to try one of these tips! Show us a cute picture of your pet!

DAY 23 + 24 | DIY starter seedlings 
​
​Your challenge:
The shape of an egg carton makes it easy to situate on a sunny windowsill and avoids the need to buy seed trays which are often made of plastic. Ask friends and family to save their egg cartons and any plastic bags for you. It may be handy if you're planning on starting a lot of seedlings at once. 

What you need: 
💚 Egg carton (alternatives: coffee cups + toilet paper rolls)
💚 Seeds of your choice
💚 Potting Soil
💚 Plastic shopping bag or alternative soft plastic

How: 
1. With a sharp tool, poke some drainage holes into the bottom of the egg carton

​2. Cut off the container lid of the egg carton and place it under the bottom of the egg carton. This way, any moisture will drain out onto the lid underneath.

​3. Fill each egg cup with potting soil and place seeds into the appropriate depth.

​4. Water the container to get the soil moist, but do not soak them.

​5. It is important to keep the seeds warm as they germinate, place the carton inside a plastic bag from the grocery store or even an empty chip packet. 
​
​Once they sprout, you can remove the plastic (wash this out and hold onto this for future use) and set your container in a sunny, warm spot until they are ready to be planted outside. 

Take a photo of your seedling's day one to keep track of growth. Let us know how you went with planting your seedlings!

DAY 21 | Bulk food shopping
​
​Your challenge:
If you haven't already, try a bulk food store! 

The reality is we never need as much as most supermarkets offer in their packaging (which is often plastic). It's good practice to think about how much we actually need. 

How: 
💚 Bring containers and jars from home! Most of these stores do sell reusable jars or offer paper bags if you do forget.
​
💚 Make a list of everything you need and tick them off.
​
💚 Schedule a fortnightly or monthly stocktake and stock up on items running low.

Share how your trip to the store went! Invite a friend and make it a cool day out.

DAY 20 | Grow food from scraps

Your challenge:
Let's grow food from scraps!

You may be surprised to learn that there are many common vegetables that you can grow from scraps. 

We're going to regrow our spring onion!

How: 
1. Keep your spring onion roots. 
2. Put them into a jar with water.
3. Leave it in a spot with a lot of sunlight and within a few days you should get some nice growth!

What have you grown from scraps? Do you have any other suggestions for us? Leave them in the comments 💚

DAY 18 | DIY origami seed packets 
​
​Your challenge:
Organise your seeds ready for sowing and make your own origami seed packets! 

If you have favourite plants you like to grow every year it makes sense to harvest your own seeds to sow. These pretty seed envelopes are fun! 

You can use any scrap of paper, grocery store receipt newspaper, junk mail, or whatever you already have lying around. 

How: 
1. Begin with a square piece of paper. Fold it diagonally into a triangle and position so the longest side is facing you.
​
2. Fold the bottom right corner up to meet the centre of the opposite side so there is a straight edge along the top.
​
3. Repeat with the bottom left corner, again meeting the opposite side. Both corners should line up across the top edge.
​
4. Tuck the first of the two triangles at the top into the triangular pocket created by making the previous fold in step 3.
​
5. You will see that you now have an envelope that you can fill with seeds. Once filled, close by tucking the remaining top triangle into the same fold as in step 4.

Glowing ✨ @joannvdherik

DAY 8 | DIY coffee body scrub

Your challenge:
So many coffee scrubs from retailers come in plastic packaging!

Let's DIY our own coffee scrub using old coffee grounds! This DIY also makes good gifts for friends and family.

What you need:
- Glass jar
- 8 Tbsp old coffee grounds
- 4 Tbsp brown sugar
- 2 Tbsp coconut oil
- Mixing spoon

How:
1. Add coffee grounds, brown sugar and coconut oil into glass jar.
2. Mix until all ingredients are combined well.

Important: Use on the body only, do not scrub on the face or near eyes. 

We have removed cinnamon from our recipe description as someone in our Instagram community has pointed out that it can be a skin irritant. 

We have tested this scrub ourselves and it didn't have any adverse reactions, but we can't expect this will be the case for everyone else's skin type. 

If you have sensitive skin or aren't comfortable with using cinnamon- leave this ingredient out.

DAY 9 + 10 | Start a soft plastics bin
​
​Your challenge:
Start a soft plastics bin in your household.
Soft plastics recycling is a less commonly practised form of recycling but it's super easy. 

How:
The easy way to tell if plastic is soft or hard is the scrunch test. If it can be scrunched into a ball, it's soft. If it holds its shape, it's hard.

The following are 'soft' plastics and would go in this bin: 
🛍 Plastic shopping bags
🍞 Bread, rice, pasta, lolly and cereal bags
🍪 Biscuit packs (but not the trays)
❄️ Frozen food bags
🫧 Bubble wrap
🍋 Fruit and veg bags and netting
🧻 Toilet paper packaging and similar product packaging
♷ Old reusable bags

IMPORTANT: Make sure your plastic is dry and as empty as possible! 

For our AU community - Did you know you can deposit your collection at any one of the 830 REDcycle Drop off points across Australia - including at Coles and Woolworths.

To our worldwide friends, do your supermarkets offer a similar service?

DAY 6 | Furoshiki fabric wrapping 

Your challenge:
Did you know not all wrapping paper is recyclable?
Let's stop using wrapping paper. It'll also be easier on your wallet as gift wrapping-related products do not tend to be cheap! #scrapthewrap

What you need:
- A gift 
- Some fabric 

How:
1. Place the fabric in a diamond shape and place a gift on top. 
2. Take one corner and place it over the gift. 
3. Take the opposite corner and tuck it under the gift. 
4. Rotate the gift so the corner you just tucked in is facing you. 
5. Grab the two corners, one in each hand and tie a double knot. Voila!

DAY 4 | What's in my garbage? 
​
​Your challenge:
Let's conduct a bin audit! Our own bin is a good starting point for seeing where we can make some eco swaps.

How: 
1. Get some reusable gloves on and open up your bin.
2. Separate distinct groups of rubbish while sorting. 
3. Draw up a table and record the waste you find. Make notes on the category of waste and weight/volume.

If you notice too many: 
Plastic wrappers + bottles → Use a reusable water bottle
​
Clothing tags + textile waste → Donate clothes or thrift!

Takeaway containers → Eat in at the restaurant or challenge yourself to cook more at home!

Let's make a Matcha Latte 🍵 
​Did you know matcha is high in antioxidants and boosts brain function?

How to make a Matcha Latte 🍵 

Ingredients: 
 1 1/2 teaspoons matcha powder
 1 tablespoon hot water
 3/4 cup hot oat milk

Steps: 
1. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons of matcha powder into a bowl.
2. Add 1 tablespoon of hot water. We recommend 80°C for optimal taste.
3. Whisk until there are no clumps. (We recommend using a matcha whisk)
4. Add matcha to the hot oat milk and mix well. Enjoy! 💚

Happy birthday @janegoodallau. Today we celebrate all you are, all you do and your continued impact and inspiration to us all. 

3 facts about Dr Jane Goodall. 

🌎 A key observation Goodall noted while studying at Gombe Stream National Park was that chimpanzees made and used tools. Prior to this discovery, scientists accepted that trait as a definition of humanity.

🌎 Goodall first travelled to what is now Tanzania in 1960, and began her first study of wild chimpanzees. Because it was deemed inappropriate for Jane to travel alone to Tanzania, authorities mandated she have an escort. Goodall took her mother along for the journey.

🌎 In 2002, Goodall was acknowledged as the UN Peace Messenger and an honorary constituent of Future World Council.

Image: Tony Burrows

"Wherever you are, close your eyes, relax your muscles and take the three deepest breaths you have all day. Feel a wave of instant calm flush through your body. Maybe it stays for a while, maybe it only stays for second; that feeling is a feeling of peace, a feeling of love and a feeling of nurture. 

Focusing on my breath has been the biggest help to me for calming anxieties. Focusing on your breath can look like noting the inhalation and exhalations by counting, or thinking about the feeling of air rushing in and out of your nose. I love to place one hand on my belly and one hand on my heart to remind myself of the devotion of love I want to give myself while feeling my belly expand and contract." 
​
​Words by @annabelletukta, wearing Boody Motivate - our active collection.

Introducing The Goodness Loop - our recycling program with @upparelofficial.

How it works:
1. Purchase your shipping label for $25 via link in bio or directly via our website. 🏷
2. Fill any box with up to 10kg of unwanted clothing, shoes, sheets etc. The best part? You’re not limited to Boody. You can recycling any textiles with us. 📦
3. Book your courier collection. They pick it up straight from your doorstep while you sit back and pat yourself on the back. 👋🏾
4. Receive a $25 Boody gift card for closing the loop with us! 🌏

*The Goodness Loop is only available in Australia. Gift card minimum spend $85 and only valid for 30 days from date of issue. Unfortunately underwear and bras cannot be accepted. We’re working on this so watch this space. See full list on our website of what you can recycle with us.

#closetheloop #recycling #sustainableliving

Save this post: how to follow Box Breathing. ✨
​
Step 1: Breathe in counting to four slowly. Feel the air enter your lungs.
Step 2: Hold your breath for 4 seconds. Try to avoid inhaling or exhaling for 4 seconds.
Step 3: Slowly exhale through your mouth for 4 seconds.
Step 4: Repeat steps 1 to 3 until you feel re-centered.

To our community,

We just wanted to give an update on our donation to NSW and QLD flood-affected communities.

We appreciate everyone who has messaged and reached out to us. We have connected with so many people over the week who simply just want to help out their community - and at times like this, looking to us for comfort in a pair of undies and socks.

We‘re working with our charity partner, Thread Together to distribute a significant donation to the estimated 10,000 people displaced due to this natural disaster.

Working with Thread Together is the best way we can ensure distribution is as effective as possible without overwhelming existing community centres. Their team have secured a pop-up location in Lismore, Indooroopilly and Milton and are working on more locations this week. This is where you will find our donation. 

We’re thinking of our whole community hurting right now.

Please reach out to us if you have any questions.

Team Boody

This International Women’s Day, we’re celebrating all the amazing women in our community who have continually shown us support, suggested products, been our wear-testers, starred in our campaigns and shared their stories with us.

At Boody, we're committed to supporting women 365 days a year. 
How? 
- We care about representation and ensure that all people in our community are represented in all that we do.
- At Boody HQ, our team have paid parental leave.
- As a brand with a B Corp badge, we are measured on team structure, management and paid leave options.

Thank you to our community for the continual inspiration this International Women's Day and beyond.

To mark the day, @capturedbysophh has shot 6 amazing women. Each brought with them stories and experiences and connected together with the desire to inspire and empower. 

#IWD #internationalwomensday

While you follow deep breathing, use a picture in your mind and a word or phrase to help you feel more relaxed. ✨
​
​Close your eyes if they're open.
Take a few big, deep breaths.
Breathe in. As you do that, imagine that the air is filled with a sense of peace and calm. Try to feel it throughout your body.
Breathe out. While you're doing it, imagine that the air leaves with your stress and tension.
Now use a word or phrase with your breath. As you breathe in, say in your mind, "I breathe in peace and calm."
As you breathe out, say in your mind, "I breathe out stress and tension."
Continue for 10 to 20 minutes.
​

To our community,

Right now, things aren't business as usual.

We like many of you are feeling overwhelmed by everything happening in the world right now.

We want to acknowledge that we’re feeling what you are feeling too and for you to know that you aren't alone.

From a natural disaster in our own backyard, Australia to a community going through so much suffering and heartache in Ukraine.

Boody is built on values that are for our community, our planet and for our own wellness.

We will always use our platform for good and use our voice and reach, to be honest, real, transparent and there for you. 

What you can expect from us
1. We’re going to focus more on lifting our community's mental health through useful content around meditation, breath-work, and anything to calm the mind. 
2. We’re going to share credible information and resources on how to support the floods in Australia. 
3. We’re working with our charity partner @thread_together to donate socks, apparel and underwear to communities in Queensland and Northern NSW. 

If you have any questions or feedback, please reach out to our Community team.

Sincerely,
Team Boody

We are now proud to be a B Corp Certified business. 🌱🌎💚

As a brand built on sustainable values, B Corp has always been a constant reminder to do things differently, with people and the planet equally top of mind. It was in late 2019, during the Covid pandemic and at a time when we all started to reflect a little bit more, that we finally took up the task of auditing and documenting everything we do to apply for B Corp certification. Awarded in late 2021, we are so proud to say that we are the first underwear brand in Australia and New Zealand to wear the B Corp badge. Did we think we were going to debut with an impressive score of 101.6? No way, but wow are we proud. In joining the global B Corp community, we solidify our promise to balance purpose and profit and consistently use our business as a force for good.

We know that this is a never-ending journey. Becoming B Corp certified isn’t simply a check box for us. It's a journey that's measured every three years which allows us to continuously work towards the highest standards of an independent body.

Now more than ever seems like an amazing opportunity to take the time to thank our community, team, partners and friends for being part of the journey - - this is really as much of your win as it is ours.

#sustainability #bcorp #ecobrand

This weekend is a good weekend to clean out your wardrobe. ♻️

Introducing The Goodness Loop - our recycling program with @upparelofficial.

How it works:
1. Purchase your shipping label for $25 via link in bio or directly via our website. 🏷 
2. Fill any box with up to 10kg of unwanted clothing, shoes, sheets etc. The best part? You’re not limited to Boody. You can recycling any textiles with us. 📦 
3. Book your courier collection. They pick it up straight from your doorstep while you sit back and pat yourself on the back. 👋🏾
4. Receive a $25 Boody gift card for closing the loop with us! 🌏

*The Goodness Loop is only available in Australia. Gift card minimum spend $85 and only valid for 30 days from date of issue. Unfortunately underwear and bras cannot be accepted. We’re working on this so watch this space. See full list on our website of what you can recycle with us. 

#closetheloop #recycling #sustainableliving

Make a Single-Serve Choc Walnut Cookie with @scoopitup_ x @boody

This is my favourite indulgent treat - I love making it for dessert on the weekends! Swapping refined flours for a healthier alternative makes this recipe gluten-free, dairy-free and paleo-friendly!

You need:
3 tbsp almond meal 
1 tbsp vanilla protein powder
1 tbsp sweetener of choice
1 tbsp tahini
Pinch rock salt 
Dash of milk of choice (I used almond milk)
1/4 cup chopped walnuts
1/4 cup chopped dark choc 

Method:
1. Mix all ingredients together besides the milk, choc, and walnuts. 
2. Once a dough has formed add your mix-ins and slowly add milk to achieve a dough consistency. 
3. Roll into a ball and press into a lined baking tin, sprinkling with some extra salt 
4. Bake at 180 degrees for 10 mins then remove to cool before enjoying, yum!

#healthyfood #wellness #foodie #recipeoftheday #recipeoftheday #wellbeing #healthylifestyle #fudge #nutrition #nutrionist

Make Collagen Fudge with @scoopitup_  x @boody 

This is one of my fave snacks I have it almost every day! It is sugar free and high in healthy fats and proteins to help sustain energy levels, enhance concentration and support hormonal regulation. 

All you need is to mix
1/2 cup melted coconut oil 
1-2 tbsp your favourite nut butter
2 scoops vanilla protein powder
Pinch rock salt
Pinch cinnamon
A few drops of stevia (or sweetener of choice)

Mix well until a paste like consistency is formed.

Mix in 1/2 cup chopped roasted almonds and 1/4 cup cacao nibs. 

Spread onto a lined baking tray and freeze for 1+ hours.

Sprinkle with your fave goodies! I love rose petals, nuts and seeds. Make sure you keep and store in freezer.

"For my entire teenage & adult life I have always believed that my likability was based on how my body looked. It depended on how flat my stomach was & how smooth my legs were… but the sadness that was attached to the constant chasing of these things was suffocating 💔

We have been led to believe that having a belly means we’ve failed. We haven’t.

I have had a lot of wholesome chats with my mum recently (who, may I add is a frikkin powerhouse of a woman) about how her actions towards herself impacted me more than she knew when I was growing up. The fact that she went on a diet, I would feel like (at 14) needed to diet. If my mum felt self conscious about her body then I felt self conscious about mine. Because, if my mum (a beautiful woman) felt unworthy in her skin then I had no right to feel confident in mine.

As I got older I started seeing other women embracing their bodies… but they had BELLIES, CELLULITE… STRETCH MARKS!! I couldn’t believe it! I was so shocked! Was I “allowed” to embrace these aspects of my body? These other women were!!

I know now that insecurities stem from a huge variety of things - celebrities, magazines, movies, adverts and so much more! What was really sad was that my mum had also been sucked into the toxic realm of diet culture, much like I had, and that made me so so so mad!!!

Even when I was at my thinnest, I never felt thin enough. We are all trying our best and putting our bodies through more emotional stress but constantly worrying what we look like is not a fun experience 🥺 trust me … I know 💔

I’m sending you a big dollop of love in case you need it today babe. You’re doing amazing."  - @sophthickfitnesss 
​

If you grow them, you should know them.  
​
#BCAM #breastcancerawareness #pinkoctober #mcgrathfoundation

She was first diagnosed with breast cancer when I was 11 years old. She underwent chemotherapy and had a mastectomy all while continuing to be a mother to three young children. In October 2020 it had returned and my mum was diagnosed with stage 4 metastatic breast cancer. It had spread almost everywhere. She’d had no idea. One minute she’d been on holiday up north of WA hiking 20km a day then a few days after she came back she had a bad cough that wouldn’t go away so she visited the doctor. Turned out it was breast cancer and she was coughing because it had spread to her lungs. But other than that she didn’t have symptoms. She started straight away with chemo and radiotherapy. I cried and she told me don’t worry, I’ve always been a fighter and I won’t stop now. Overnight her life changed drastically. She had to stop going to work and began to loosing her hair but she did it with a strength, courage, smile and even laughter I was in contrast awe of. She changed the emoji on her phone to a bald one and saw every day as a fashion show to brighten the lives of those around her and herself and to wear all the pretty clothes she had. 

My mum died in May 2021. Due to complications from surgery. It was a big shock. Even to all her doctors. There’s always a risk with surgery but you never think the worst will happen. She’d been doing so well and the treatments had been working so much so she was going to get a break and my parents booked a few holidays.

I know my mum would want to spread the message to check yourself, go to get checked and to remind those around you to get checked. I know she’d want to spread the message the huge impact breast cancer can have on those who are diagnosed and their loved ones and just to love big, laugh big and show gratitude for everyday. 

I want people go know how many people it impacts. How deeply it impacts loved ones. People don’t want to talk about. But we need to. Even if it’s hard. Problems don’t go away if we ignore them. 

Loosing my mum is probably the greatest loss I will ever experience. 

#breastcancerawareness #breastawareness

1. In the Shower
With the pads/flats of your 3 middle fingers, check the entire breast and armpit area pressing down with light, medium, and firm pressure. Check both breasts each month feeling for any lump, thickening, hardened knot, or any other breast changes.

2. In Front of a Mirror 
Visually inspect your breasts with your arms at your sides. Next, raise your arms high overhead.
​
​Look for any changes in the contour, any swelling, or dimpling of the skin, or changes in the nipples. Next, rest your palms on your hips and press firmly to flex your chest muscles. Left and right breasts will not exactly match—few women’s breasts do, so look for any dimpling, puckering, or changes, particularly on one side.

3. Lying Down
When lying down, the breast tissue spreads out evenly along the chest wall. Place a pillow under your right shoulder and your right arm behind your head. Using your left hand, move the pads of your fingers around your right breast gently covering the entire breast area and armpit.

Use light, medium, and firm pressure. Squeeze the nipple; check for discharge and lumps. Repeat these steps for your left breast.
​
​If you grow them, you should know them. October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month. 
​

✨ Why today?
Today is Metastatic Breast Cancer Awareness Day. Metastatic Breast Cancer is cancer that has spread beyond the breast to other organs in the body, such as the bones, lungs, liver or brain. As things currently stand, once this has occurred, there is no cure. Acknowledging Metastatic Breast Cancer Awareness Day tells those living with the disease they are not alone on what is often an uncertain and scary journey.

✨ Why McGrath Foundation?
The McGrath Foundation raises money to fund McGrath Breast Care Nurses who provide invaluable support and care to women and men experiencing breast cancer. From diagnosis right throughout treatment, McGrath Breast Care Nurses are available to help individuals and their families for free and with no referral. A breast cancer diagnosis changes your life, often in ways you wouldn’t expect.

Learn more via IG stories.

​​​​​What’s the first thing you think to look for when you hear the phrase ‘check your breasts’? It’s often the idea that you’re looking for a lump. Right? 

Did you know that there are actually 12 symptoms of breast cancer that can help you be more confident to report a persistent breast change? We bet you also didn't know that the changes to look out for are very similar for both women and men.

October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, an annual campaign to raise awareness about the impact of breast cancer. ✨

Share this post to help us increase awareness about breasts - because if you grow them, you should know them.

Did you know that breast cancer is the most commonly diagnosed cancer in Australia, with 9 people losing their lives to the disease every day? 
​
​October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month - the time of year where we collectively increase attention and support for the awareness, early detection and treatment of the disease.
​
​This month, we’ll be using our platform to highlight how to check your breasts, revealing the fast facts and providing resources and insights via personal stories. 
​
​Knowing your breasts could save your life. Read how to check your breasts via IG Stories now. 
​

🌱 Since it was first announced in 2009, World Bamboo Day has become an important event to raise awareness about this fast-growing grass. At Boody, bamboo is the foundation for everything we make. 

🌍 Did you know that the bamboo plant is one of the most sustainable plants in the world? It requires little water, grows rapidly, can continue to grow after harvest, and has natural properties that make it antibacterial, insect repellent during growth and thermoregulating. 

 💚 Today, we want you to know a little bit more about bamboo, its sustainable benefits and why bamboo has a better impact on the fashion industry.

We asked @laurakelly_yoga for her go-to wellness tips. Here’s what she sent us! 💚🌱🌏

“As we find ourselves living in a time where our movement is restricted, lockdowns in places and STILL unable to see friends and family overseas I am back reminding myself how important it is to take extra special care of myself. Too easily we lose track of what keeps us going, what keeps us smiling and what keeps us sane. The spiralling anxiety and worry can feel like it comes out of nowhere if we’re not careful so, take note. How are you taking care of yourself right now?”

I am…

😮‍💨 taking deep breaths
🍃 going outside every day
🧘🏻‍♀️ doing simple, grounding yoga poses 
🍲 eating good food 
☕️ drinking warm drinks 
😴 taking more naps
📞 staying connected with friends + family

"This is my body. And I think it is amazing. I know it’s different to yours. I know I have a lot of scars and skin grafts. And I know I have surgical scars. And I know I have no legs. And I know one stump is shorter than the other. But none of that matters !!! I mean, I can walk on prosthetic legs which is in my opinion incredible !!!! I can do things that I never dreamt of doing because I was told that I couldn’t !!!! So my question is why should I be shamed because I’m disabled ? I shouldn’t be. Why should disabled people be shamed because their bodies are different to yours ? They shouldn’t be. This needs to be changed urgently. 
​This is why I celebrate and share every small step in my journey. Because instead of shaming my body and myself and others for being disabled, I think we should all celebrate every. freaking. win. I might not be able to do everything, I might have a body that is different to you and a life that is a lot different also. But honestly, what I can do compared to what I could do just a year ago is huge - so if you did something today that is a win for you, then celebrate the absolute hell out of it - you deserve to." - @lauren_mcdonough in Boody. ✨

What you need 🫐 
200 g quinoa
1 tablespoon ground chia
375 ml of your choice of milk (soy, almond, dairy, seed)
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
2 organic eggs
½ teaspoon baking soda
3 bananas - smashed

What to do 🥞 
1. Combine quinoa, chia and milk
2. Soak for 1 hour 
3. Add vanilla, cinnamon, eggs and baking soda and mix until smooth
4. Add in the smashed bananas 
5. Cook in a pan over low-medium heat until golden.
6. Serve with your preferred toppings!

How to do it:

💫 Close your mouth and inhale quietly through your nose to a mental count of four.

🌏 Hold your breath for a count of seven.

🌱 Exhale completely through your mouth, making a whoosh sound to a count of eight.

🌗 Now inhale again and repeat the cycle three more times for a total of four breaths.

#meditation #478breathingtechnique #yoga #nature #organic #ecofriendly #ecoconscious #ethicalconsumer #ethicalblogger #ethicalliving

July is #disabilitypridemonth and @lauren_mcdonough has something to say! 
​
"​I am a firm believer that disabilities DO NOT change who a person is in anyway shape or form, yet people with disabilities are still treated with outdated information when it comes to treatment, discriminatory belief systems and stigma. Just because someone has a disability it does not give you the right to bully them, or does not give you the right to be ableist towards them. They. Are. Still. Human. Beings. ‼️ I’m a bilateral below knee amputee - but also suffer from severe fibromyalgia, cfs, treatment resistant depression, complex post traumatic stress disorder, generalised anxiety disorder and other things in regards to my accident 4 years ago. I haven’t been able to work since this. I am proud of who I am, and I never try to let what I go through stop me - but the symptoms, flare ups, pain, isolation and everything that has come with it has been severely debilitating. Having a disability isn’t fun - experiencing #chronicillness & #chronicpain on top of it all has been defeating. It has changed the way I have had to do things, but it hasn’t changed who I am as a person and it never will. Yes it isn’t all easy, not being able to work currently pisses me off but I am hopeful I will be able to. This month I encourage you to read blogs from those with a disability, try to educate yourselves on conditions those you know might have, buy a book written by a disabled person, support disabled people’s businesses and generally speaking, as we always should be - treat us with respect. My illnesses and disability may stop me from what you are able to do, but I am proud of who I am, and no disability will take that away from me."
​

So, why did we make LYOLYTE™? 🌱🌎💚
​
At Boody, we are committed to building an honest and responsible business, and creating sustainable everyday basics that fit into your eco lifestyle and values. We put sustainable thinking at the center of everything we do. It inspires us to constantly innovate while keeping people and the planet top of mind. We’re always looking at what our community wants and after listening and reviewing, we decided we wanted to create a new underwear collection in a lighter fabric with still the same sustainable properties. This led us into exploring the lyocell process - crafting new styles and colours that give women a top drawer option that is a little bit more luxurious, oh so lightweight, yet still sustainable.

What makes LYOLYTE™ sustainable? 

☁️ Lyocell utilises a 'closed-loop' system where 99% of the non toxic solvent used is recycled. 
☁️ During the production process Lyocell also has the potential to use less than half as much water in production compared to cotton. 
☁️ It’s free from harmful chemicals and needs less energy to be produced. 
☁️ Like all our underwear, LYOLYTE™ is made using a seam free design process where the garment is spun together rather than cut from a fabric cloth meaning it does not create waste from offcuts.

@jadetunchy wears LYOLYTE™.  A new fabric made using the traditional Lyocell process but instead using Boody's signature organic bamboo. 💚🌱🌎

The Lyocell process utilises a 'closed-loop' system where 99% of the non toxic solvent used is recycled. The Lyocell is free from harmful chemicals and requires less energy to produce and half as much water compared to cotton. The Lyocell process absorbs dye better than other cellulose fibres resulting in vibrant colours and less dye being needed.

What’s the first thing you do when you get home? The take-your-bra-off-as-soon-as-you-can is a familiar scenario for many women. It’s a liberating feeling that follows with an instant ooh and ahh and signals the end of a long day. Yep, you made it - now off it comes. 

But when you think about why you dislike wearing a bra on a daily basis, what are some of the top reasons on your list? For many, it’s the consensus that the under-wire feels restrictive and uncomfortable, especially after wearing it for 8+ hours. 

We’re redefining the way you think about bras and have designed super-soft, seamfree and wireless styles that can be worn out of the house as much as they can when you want to relax at home. 
​
​Meet our latest, the Ribbed Seamless Bra via IG stories now. It's the perfect balance of style and comfort.

This year's theme for International Women's Day is #ChooseToChallenge and we asked Phoebe, @modelappetite what it means to her. 🌱

In a world where “beauty” is put on a pedestal, a world where social platforms showcase idyllic lives, a world where we must all say the right thing, do the right thing and think the right thing. Being “perfect” is easier said than done right?

This year IWD is asking us to #ChooseToChallenge and I choose to challenge my perception of perfection and the standards social media places on me as a mother, a wife, a model and a woman.

I have many times succumbed to the pressures of “perfect parenting”, of trying to live up to an unrealistic social media expectation, of having a relationship with my husband that Hollywood and Disney movies tell us it should be. I won’t pretend that I haven’t only posted photos of life’s highlights to my Instagram, or lied in a conversation with my fellow mamas about what deliciously, nutritious food I fed my kids for lunch, or written down smaller measurements on a casting form. It’s exhausting.
 
I want my girls to grow up in a world where being themselves wholeheartedly is something to be encouraged and celebrated. And in order for that to happen I need to be the example. 
I’m sure that most of us can look at the first photo of me and see that I’m leaning back to lengthen my body, have moved my arm behind me to appear more slender, am tensing my stomach to look more defined and have straightened my legs to look leaner. I’m doing this because, hey, why not want to post a photo in which I feel I look the most flattering version of myself? However, I wouldn’t be doing my message justice if I didn’t post a second photo of myself which shows off another equally, beautifully, honest version of me.

This is me. But the second image is also me. This is the first time I have ever posted, what I feel to be a rather uncomplimentary photo of myself on social media. It’s scary but it’s also incredibly freeing. The definition of freedom – the power to determine action without restraint.

So in short, this IWD I choose to be free, not perfect #ChooseToChallenge

When we rise to the occasion, amazing things happen. We are agents of change. We rise to the challenge of being our true selves, of loving who we love, of discovering our own identities, culture and creativity.

It's World Environment Day! And there's never been a more important time to take action on protecting our planet.⁠
⁠
From last summer’s devastating bushfires to our increasingly polluted seas, there’s no denying the impact our actions have on the Earth. That’s why we all need to take steps to reduce our footprint and live a more sustainable life this World Environment Day and beyond.⁠
⁠
Link in bio to find out more about what World Environment Day is and how you can get involved. And don't forget to join the conversation and spread the word #WorldEnvironmentDay #ForNature #EveryBoody 🌏

.⁠

To our customers, colleagues and the wider community,⁠
⁠
We know you’re probably feeling a bit anxious right now. We are too. With news updates about COVID-19 changing not only by the day but by the hour, these are strange and uncertain times. It’s essential that we all come together to not only look out for one another, but for our global community at large.⁠
⁠
Our roots are in health and wellness, so while it’s tough to navigate the unknown, the health and safety of our customers, employees and local communities is innately important to us. This is why we’ve implemented a response policy at Boody HQ.⁠
⁠
In addition to this, we’re working closely with our suppliers to ensure their safety while also fulfilling your orders and responding to your needs as quickly as we can. Rest assured, Boody is in a unique position to weather the storm due to our sufficient supply of seasonless stock. Our Customer Happiness team is on hand as always to answer any questions you may have via chat or support ticket.⁠
⁠
As the situation evolves, so may our plans. But right now, the best thing we can all do is look after ourselves and each other. And remember, Boody’s here to make you feel that bit more comfortable – both inside and out. ⁠
⁠
Thoughtfully,⁠
⁠
Shaun and the team at Boody⁠

Globally, the apparel and footwear industry accounts for 8% of the world’s greenhouse gas emissions. If that number isn't scary enough, try this – it also accounts to 3,990 million metric tons of carbon dioxide being released into the atmosphere each year. That’s a lot of carbon dioxide.⁠
⁠
By supporting slow fashion, you’ll be lowering your carbon footprint – imagine if everyone else decided to do the same?⁠
⁠
For more reasons why it's important to support slow fashion, follow the link in our bio!

Here at Boody, we’re huge advocates of shopping locally – that’s why we put so much effort into supporting over 1,000 independent local retailers around the country.⁠
⁠
The most common question we get asked is: “Are you in [insert store name here]?”⁠
⁠
We love saying yes, but too often we still do have to say no, and we’re tired of saying no. Boody is on a mission to add new locations and we’re asking for your help – because we know that the more local retailers we’re in, the more local experiences we can create (and the more Boody you can enjoy!).⁠
⁠
Here’s how you can help. Comment below with the name of a store that you feel would thrive with Boody. Bonus points if you tag them, include their phone/email and a hug from our Managing Director if you make a personal introduction.⁠
⁠
Are you a shop? Follow the link in bio to learn more about becoming a Boody Stockist.⁠
⁠

Consider taking a trip to a town affected by the bushfires later this year. The devastation left in the wake of these bushfires has not only damaged and destroyed lives and homes, but businesses too.⁠
⁠
Do your bit to help get these towns back on their feet by taking a visit and spending some money. You'll end up meeting some friendly, interesting people and seeing a place you might not have otherwise!⁠ Plan your #roadtripforgood to support bushfire-affected communities and tag @roadtripforgood to share your roadtrip.

We are beyond devastated and feel it’s our responsibility to take action. Boody will be donating $10,000 to helping those affected by the bushfire crisis – our communities, wildlife and our environment. $5,000 will be donated to @redcrossau and $5,000 will be donated to @wireswildliferescue.⁠
⁠
Back in December we ran a campaign and donated 1,500 pairs of Boody undies to those displaced by the fires. Through our work with @thread_together we have seen firsthand how the simplest actions such as clothing those who have lost their basic needs can make such a huge difference. But we still want to do more.⁠
⁠
We have a responsibility as a company with influence to help. We hope this encourages others to donate what they can, or if not in a position to donate, to donate time, or simply talk about the issues. Education can have the biggest impact.⁠
⁠
We’ve rounded up 10 ways to help with the bushfires crisis on our blog, from donating time and money to leaving water outside for fleeing animals and spreading the word online. Join us. Help in any way you can. Link in bio to read the post now.⁠
⁠
Stay strong, Australia. We’re all in this together.⁠
⁠
#bushfires #australianbushfires #australianbushfirecrisis⁠

Have you heard of @thread_together? They partner with leading fashion labels to distribute excess stock into the hands of those who need it most. Which, as we approach winter, is more important than ever.⁣
⁣
Sunsuper's Dreams for a Better World program supports not-for-profit organisations that help bring lasting and positive change to Australians. How would a Dreams for a Better World grant help Thread Together? By enabling them to outfit and furnish two new Hubs in Melbourne and Darwin for launch in 2020.⁣
⁣
So what can you do to help? Well, it's super easy. Just follow the link in our bio to vote for Thread Together to win the Dreams for a Better World grant. Instead of clothing ending up in a landfill, you'll be helping it to be sent out to those who are really in need.⁣
⁣

Rise of the sustainable wardrobe 🙏🏻
.
.
.
1. Buy clothes that will last – poor quality, poor lifespan! 
2. Invest in trans-seasonal clothes
3. When buying, ask yourself if you will wear this garment 30+ times
4. Look after your clothes so they last longer
5. Keep a list of things you want, this can avoid impulse/unnecessary purchases

Thread Together is a fantastic nonprofit very unique in its kind. They help bring fresh clothing to the people who need it most across Australia. They do this by collecting excess and discontinued stocks from their network of fashion partners. ⠀⠀
⠀⠀
Here's the team at work unpacking some Boody underwear which will be soon distributed. ⠀⠀
⠀⠀
We're so happy to be able to contribute to their initiative and help provide some of the most basic wardrobe essentials we too often take for granted.

This Mother's Day, we've partnered with PropellerProjects, a non-profit organisation that is dedicated to creating sustainable change and improving the conditions of new mothers in developing countries.⠀ ⠀
Every hour, 33 women die in childbirth around the world﻿. These deaths can be prevented​ by distributing simple birthing kits to provide a clean and safe environment for mothers and their babies.⠀
⠀
We've pledged to donate 10% of the value of every Women's, Baby and Gift Card products sold between May 5 and 14, 2017 to PropellerProjects. ⠀

* grown organically 🎍

* fast growing, regenerating
for HEΛLTH :
* anti-bacterial & anti-fungal
* hypo-allergenic 💫
* breathable & moisture wicking
for COMFORT :
* silky soft 🌹
* thermo-regulating

Did you know that bamboo has been preferred construction material for the majority of the world, for thousands of years?
Bamboo can replace wood or steel in any use, such as Ex Floors, furniture, bicycles, kitchen utensils, rope and scaffolding.. Almost everything imaginable!
Now there's only a week to boody is launched on the Danish market!
